briefTitle: A Study of the Safety and Efficacy of Golimumab in Subjects With Active Ankylosing Spondylitis
officialTitle: A Multicenter, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Trial of Golimumab, a Fully Human Anti-TNFalpha MonoclonalAntibody, Administered Subcutaneously, in Subjects With Active Ankylosing Spondylitis
summary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of subcutaneous injections (under the skin) of golimumab for the treatment of active ankylosing spondylitis \[AS(arthritis of the spine)\]. Efficacy will be measured by reduction in the signs and symptoms of active AS, including effects on back pain and stiffness, physical function, range of motion in the spine, quality of life, and rate of spine damage or fusion on x-ray.

primaryOutcome.measure: Assessment in Ankylosing Spondylitis 20 Responders at Week 14
